title: (x) That Recent Sans Serif with Partially Rounded Caps
content:
Somewhere in the blogosphere a month or two ago I saw a sans serif, clean font where the lines terminated with an end that was rounded, but there were still corners where the curve met the lines. (see the attached photo)

I’ve been scouring google reader and a few blogs i frequent but cannot find it. This is a shot in the dark, but your help is appreciated.

PS - Apologies if my terminology is incorrect. I welcome your corrections.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Photo 23.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144832/http:/typophile.com/files/Photo%2023.jpg) | 55.53 KB |

 [‹ type ID help please](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41772 "Go to previous forum topic") [Garamonds ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41810 "Go to next forum topic")
author: frappajon

comments.content: Your illustration reminds me of [Armchair Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144832/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/psyops/armchair_modern_set_ot/), but it doesn’t match your description.

Sorry, I’m being confusing... what I drew was the outline of a single ascender, for example. To clarify, I’ve uploaded another image:

[http://thanksinternet.com/images/Photo%2024.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144832/http:/thanksinternet.com/images/Photo%2024.jpg)
Is it possible that you are talking about my very own [Subtil](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144832/http:/tdc.org/news/2007Results/Subtil.html)?
SUBTIL! that’s the one. I appreciate all of your help.
